page.title: 10Schools in East Leicester.
page.content: {Highfields Infant School:}The school was opened in 1946 in Sparkenhoe St. but is now re-located in the old Whitehall Infants School building. This is a temporary arrangement while rebuilding work is carried out. There are 158 children aged 4-7,with 7 teachers,2 nursery nurses & 7 ancillary staff. For 90% of pupils Hindi,Gujerati & Bengali are the mother tongue.{ {Coleman Junior School:}The school was opened in 1932 on The Wayne Way. The road which split the school building from the playground is now closed, leaving only a footpath. There are 280 pupils aged 7-11,with 14 teachers & 2 ancillary staff. About 70% of the children are of Asian or West Indian origin but tend to be bi-lingual.There are plans to amalgamate in the future with Coleman Infant School.
